Question
========

Om 4 behandelingen (1, 2, 3, en 4) met elkaar te vergelijken op gemiddelde effectiviteit worden in 5 klinieken (A, B, C, D en E) 4 personen door loting over de behandelingen verdeeld. De gegevens worden m.b.v. ANOVA geanalyseerd. Welke nulhypothese kan hier zinvol getoetst worden?

Answerlist
----------
* &mu;<sub>1<\/sub> = &mu;<sub>2<\/sub> = &mu;<sub>3<\/sub> = &mu;<sub>4<\/sub>
* &mu;<sub>A<\/sub> = &mu;<sub>B<\/sub> = &mu;<sub>C<\/sub> = &mu;<sub>D<\/sub> = &mu;<sub>E<\/sub>
* &sigma;<sup>2<\/sup><sub>1<\/sub> = &sigma;<sup>2<\/sup><sub>2<\/sub> = &sigma;<sup>2<\/sup><sub>3<\/sub> = &sigma;<sup>2<\/sup><sub>4<\/sub>
* &sigma;<sup>2<\/sup><sub>A<\/sub> = &sigma;<sup>2<\/sup><sub>B<\/sub> = &sigma;<sup>2<\/sup><sub>C<\/sub> = &sigma;<sup>2<\/sup><sub>D<\/sub> = &sigma;<sup>2<\/sup><sub>E<\/sub>

Solution
========

The correct answer is  &mu;<sub>1<\/sub> = &mu;<sub>2<\/sub> = &mu;<sub>3<\/sub> = &mu;<sub>4<\/sub>
